components.html:
List all known site investigation, risk assessment (including screening level risk assessment), remediation plan and confirmation of remediation reports completed and directly supporting correspondence submitted (for subject site and offsite impacted sites). 

List documents in order from newest to oldest.
components.label: Content
Includes Stage 1 PSI information as listed in CSR Section 58 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.?
Includes Stage 2 PSI information as listed in CSR Section 59 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.?
Includes DSI information as listed in CSR Section 59 and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.?
According to other guidelines? (Provide explanation below. Indicate how reports assist understanding of conditions and remediation.)

components.html: If investigation reports are incomplete or if reports are titled differently or have a different scope than those listed above in accordance with the Contaminated Sites Regulation (i.e. PSI, DSI), complete Section 4.8 (Investigation or Interpretation Issues)
components.label: Content
Topography
components.description: Describe steepness, direction of slope and position of site in relation to surrounding land

components.label: Stratigraphy
components.description: Describe depth and thickness, grain size, etc. of typical stratigraphic components and note depth to cemented or very compact materials, bedrock / refusal, etc.

components.label: Hydrogeology
components.description: Describe groundwater levels, confining / semi-confining layers, flow velocity and hydraulic conductivity. Provide arguments and supporting data to show compliance with Protocol 21 "Water Use Determination" where a specified groundwater use (DW, AW, IW or LW) has been determined not to apply. Provide explicit statements and description for every geological unit where an exemption from a specified water use is proposed to apply (add additional pages if necessary).

components.label: Surface water features - freshwater
components.description: List name, direction and distance to nearest surface water bodies and the characteristics (e.g., relative size / flow) of the water body

components.label: Surface water features - marine waters
components.description: List name, direction and distance to nearest surface water bodies and the characteristics (e.g., relative size / flow) of the water body

components.html: Describe land use/activities for each applicable area
components.label: Content
Proposed land use of subject site
Describe proposed land use/activities for subject site
If 'Other' is specified above, please explain: (e.g. applicable or excluded guidance, protocols or policies specific to the site)
Protocol 2 site-specific standards have been applied
Note: If P2 site-specific numerical standards selected above, identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for application of the site-specific numerical standard.
Protocol 4 background standards have been applied
Note: If P4 background selected above, identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for why the background concentration applies.
More than one land use applies at this site

If more than one land use applies to the site, specify additional land uses covered by the document, i.e., riparian areas, roadways, etc. include a diagram to clearly show the area(s) with different standards.
If 'Other' is specified above, please explain: (e.g. applicable or excluded guidance, protocols or policies specific to the site)
Protocol 2 site-specific standards have been applied
Note: If P2 site-specific numerical standards selected above, identify the substance and provide rationale for application of the site-specific numerical standard.
Protocol 4 background concentrations have been applied
Note: If P4 background concentrations selected above, identify the substance(s) and provide rationale for why the background concentration applies.
More than one land use apply at this site

If more than one land use is proposed for the site, specify additional land uses covered by the document, i.e., riparian areas, roadways, etc. include a diagram to clearly show the area(s) with different standards.
Attention: attach diagram if more than one land use applies

components.html: Offsite Impacted Property(ies) / Management Area Land Use

components.title: 4.5 Areas of Potential Environmental Concern (APEC) and Potential Contaminants of Concern (PCOC) Summary
components.label: Panel

components.html: Provide reference to a figure showing onsite and offsite APECs and PCOCs associated with each APEC
components.label: Content

components.html: List individual substances or groups of substances and their Chemical Abstract Service Numbers as they appear in the applicable schedule of the CSR. Attach additional lists or tables as needed.
components.label: Content
APEC Description(Describe location in relation to process source, waste, fill, land use or activity, etc, giving risk to APEC and if APEC is primarily due to soil or water contamination)
PCOC(s)(Indicate products, chemical, waste type, etc., and/or analytical parameter.)

components.title: 4.6 Areas of Environmental Concern (AEC) and Contaminants of Concern (COC) Summary
components.label: Panel

components.html:
Stage 2 Preliminary Site Investigation (PSI) 

Provide references to figure(s) showing the AEC and COC associated with each AEC in onsite and offsite soil, water, sediment and/or vapour. Sample locations and corresponding analytical results shall be shown on each figure and in tabular form with comparison to applicable standards:
components.label: Content

components.html:
Detailed Site Investigation (DSI) 

Provide references to figures (plan and xross-section), with contours, showing the specific lateral and vertical distribution of each contaminant of concern in onsite and offsite soil, sediment, water and vapour. Sections shall be longitudinal and transverse with respect to groundwater flow and include physical conditions (e.g. stratigraphy, water table etc.). Sample locations with corresponding analytical results shall be shown on the figure and in tabular form with comparison to applicable standards:
components.label: Content
AEC (use same #s as APECs in table above)
Medium
components.placeholder: e.g. soil, groundwater, sediment, vapour, surface water, other

components.label: Notes
components.placeholder: e.g. site type, classification, relevant approvals, etc.

components.label: There is evidence that one or more substances migrated or is likely to have migrated to a neighbouring property and is or is likely causing contamination of the neighbouring property
Preferential pathways have been assessed (including assessment of all neighbouring underground utility rights-of-way)

values.label: Current offsite transport of contaminants from the site
Historical offsite transport of contaminants from the site

components.label: Offsite transport of contaminants from the site in:
Briefly describe the nature of and evidence for offsite migration (either known, suspected, or potential)
The impacted offsite lands are categorized as:

values.label: Being aquatic habitat, as formally defined

components.title: 4.8 Investigation or Interpretation Issues to be Adressed
components.label: Panel

Identify any issues regarding investigations or interpretations if the PSI and DSI information may not satisfy the requirements of CSR Sections 58 and 59 and applicable protocols and guidance documents. For example: incomplete delineation or other situations that do not require a Protocol 6 preapproval; incomplete investigation due to inaccessible APEC; or application of statistics to interpret data.  Briefly describe how these issues will be addressed. Enter n/a if not applicable.

Includes quantitative human health and ecological risk assessment report information or screening level risk assessment under EMA, CSR and current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists?
Includes CSR specified information for a Remediation Plan (see CSR S.1, 16, 47) and current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists, etc.
Includes CSR specified information (see CSR S.49) and any current applicable ministry protocols, guidelines, checklists for COR reports
According to other guidelines (Provide explanation in notes below. Indicate how reports assist understanding of conditions and/or remediation.)

components.html: If completed remediation reports are not adequate or if reports have a different scope than those listed above in accordance with the CSR complete Section VI - Outstanding Remediation Issues.
components.label: Content

components.html: Describe all aspects of remediation including regulatory actions and activities to comply with numerical and/or risk-based standards
components.label: Content
Regulatory: e.g.Notification of Independent Remediation, Approval in Principle, Certificate of Compliance, Determination, Restrictive Covenant etc.
If commitments or conditions to be met are included in an Approval in Principle issued for the site, list these conditions and identify how they were or will be met through remedial activities.
Remediation to comply with numerical standards (Excavation / disposal of soil, Treatment of soil; Treatment of groundwater, etc.)
Remediation to comply with risk-based standards:
Describe risk management / exposure reduction methods intended or implemented and indicate the status of any measures.
components.placeholder: e.g., site type, engineering risk controls, institutional risk controls, restrictive covenants, financial security, etc.

Identify any issues with remediation or interpretation. components.label: Recommendation under Protocol 6

components.title: 7.1 Certification Document and Summary Recommendation
components.label: Panel

components.html: Based on my review of the documentation listed in Part 3 of this Summary of Site Condition – in comparison to the requirements and expectations of the Environmental Management Act, Contaminated Sites Regulation, protocols and supporting ministry policy and guidance – I recommend that the director consider issuance of the following certification:
components.label: Content

values.label: A Determination under section 44 of EMA
An AiP under section 53 (1) of EMA
A CoC under section 53(3) of EMA

components.html: The above recommendation, supported by my professional opinion, is based on the following:
components.label: Content
For a recommendation for a Determination
For a recommendation for an Approval in Principle and for a Certificate of Compliance
For a recommendation for a Site Risk Reclassification

values.label: On the basis of information provided and reviewed, it is my opinion that no CSR Schedule 2 activities have occurred at the subject site.

CSR Schedule 2 activities are known or suspected to have occurred at the subject site, therefore in my opinion contaminants may have been released onto the subject site so that the site would be classified as a contaminated site in accordance with the CSR.

CSR Schedule 2 activities are known or suspected to have occurred at the subject site, but it is my opinion that the specific nature of such activities would not result in contamination so that the site would be classified as a contaminated site in accordance with the CSR

components.label: Preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. No substances were identified in concentrations exceeding those identified in BC CSR Schedules 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 or 3.4, as applicable. All PCOCs have been listed in Schedule B of the draft Determination.

components.html: For a recommendation for an Approval in Principle
components.label: Content

The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12 or the director has issued a preapproval under Protocol 6 allowing the application to be submitted with the recommendation of an Approved Professional.

A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. One or more substances were identified at concentrations exceeding applicable standards or criteria in CSR Schedules 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 or 3.4.

A detailed site investigation addressing the locations and extent of all identified areas of environmental concern (AECs) and contaminants of concern (COCs) was completed and forms the basis of a remediation plan or risk assessment, OR;
An incomplete detailed site investigation forms the basis of a remediation plan or risk assessment (details were provided in Section 4.8).
When this summary of site condition was prepared

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of all identified contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards, OR
values.value: formsTheBasisOfARemediationPlanOrRiskAssessmentA remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of all identified contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards, OR

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of a specified area of contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards (with issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval or sufficient rationale was provided to identify area-wide or flow-through contamination) OR
values.value: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes remediation of a specified area of contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards (with issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval or sufficient rationale was provided to identify area-wide or flow-through contamination) OR

values.label: A remediation plan had been prepared that includes supplementary site investigation to complete full site delineation and remediation of all contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards.
values.value: aRemediationPlanHadBeenPreparedThatIncludesSupplementarySiteInvestigationToCompleteFullSiteDelineationAndRemediationOfAllContaminationToEitherCsrNumericalOrRiskBasedStandardsA remediation plan had been prepared that includes supplementary site investigation to complete full site delineation and remediation of all contamination to either CSR numerical or risk-based standards.

components.label: A schedule with estimated dates for implementing remediation was provided.

The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12 or the director has issued a preapproval under Protocol 6 allowing the application to be submitted with the recommendation of an Approved Professional.

A preliminary site investigation addressing all identified areas of potential environmental concern (APECs) and potential contaminants of concern (PCOCs) was completed. One or more substances were identified at concentrations exceeding applicable standards or criteria in CSR Schedules 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 or 3.4

A detailed site investigation addressing the locations and extent of all identified areas of environmental concern (AECs) and contaminants of concern (COCs) was completed and was the basis for remediation of the site, OR

An incomplete detailed site investigation (due to issuance of a Protocol 6 preapproval, or justification to not delineate or remediate the entire extent of contamination) was the basis for remediation of the site.
When this summary of site condition was prepared contaminants identified in investigation and risk assessment reports had been remediated to CSR numerical concentration or risk-based standards.

components.html: For a recommendation for a Site Risk Reclassification
components.label: Content

values.label: The site is classified as risk-managed high risk under Protocol 12.
The site is classified as non-high risk under Protocol 12.

components.title: 7.2 Substances Remediated or Standards or Criteria Applied
components.label: Panel

components.html: Contaminants have been remediated to comply with standards or criteria listed in the following table: (If the site required remediation and has been remediated.)
components.label: Content

components.html: Use specific compound names as listed in the Contaminated Sites Regulation Schedules. Please list compounds in columns to aid review.
components.label: Content
Land use the substance(s) have been remediated to in soil (Please select all that apply)
Water use the substance(s) have been remediated to (Please select all that apply)

components.html: The Director may accept the recommendations of an Approved Professional(s) based on the review of investigation, risk assessment, and/or remediation reports, with  the understanding that:
components.label: Content

As of the date of signing of this report the Approved Professional, or Approved Professionals if more than one, is/are member(s) in good standing of the Roster of Approved Professionals, as maintained by the ministry, and member(s) of the Contaminated Sites Approved Professionals Society (CSAP Society);

The Approved Professionals signing this Summary of Site Condition have reviewed Table 1, Protocol 6 for Contaminated Sites (Applications with Approved Professional Recommendations and Preapprovals) and confirm that the application for contaminated sites services may be processed in the manner for non-high risk sites under the Roster of Approved Professionals process;

The reviewer has no obligation to undertake any inquiry into the validity, accuracy or precision of what is reported in the documents reviewed, beyond that which there is reasonable cause to believe that there could be errors or oversights in those reports;

The site has been satisfactorily investigated for all areas of (potential) environmental concern and (potential) contaminants of concern to determine the lateral and vertical extents of contamination; OR
The site has been investigated to the extent reasonably possible for all areas of (potential) environmental concern and (potential) contaminants of concern;
The submitted documentation meets the requirements of Sections 1, 47, 49, 58 and 59 of the CSR;
The Screening Level Risk Assessment meets the requirements of Protocol 13;

The submitted remediation plan, if implemented in accordance with the specified conditions imposed in its draft Schedule 'B' of the AiP, will result in the site being remediated in accordance with the applicable standards of the CSR and the HWR;
It is feasible to implement all provisions of the Remediation Plan and to achieve its objectives, and the conditions of the AIP, in accordance with the proposed schedule;
The confirmation of remediation report meets the requirements of section 49 (2) of the CSR;
The site has been satisfactorily remediated in accordance with section 53 (3) of the EMA and section 49(2) of the CSR in accordance with applicable standards as identified in the draft COC;
Contamination exists beyond the legal lot boundaries
The off-site portion(s) of the site has/have been satisfactorily remediated in accordance with section 53 (3) of the EMA and section 49(2) of the CSR and makes up part of this application, OR
A remediation plan, in accordance with requirements of the CSR, sections 1 and 47, has been prepared and application has been made for an AiP for the off-site portions;

For CoCs where contamination exists beyond the legal lot boundaries and engineered works are required to prevent recontamination of the site,  a signed and stamped design drawing has been provided by a professional engineer for works installed at site boundaries to prevent recontamination of the site. The signatory need not be the Approved Professional signing below.
In accordance with section 15 (5) of the CSR, the subject site is a contaminated site under section 44(1) of the Environmental Management Act;
In accordance with section 15 (5) of the CSR, the subject site is a contaminated site under section 44 (3) of EMA.

components.html: The opinions, advice and recommendations expressed in this Summary of Site Condition are made in accordance with generally accepted principles and practices as recognized by members of the applicable profession or discipline practicing at the same time and in the same or similar locations. This Summary of Site Condition does not provide a legal opinion or guarantee regarding compliance with applicable laws.
components.label: Content

components.title: 7.3 Arm's Length Review
components.label: Panel
An arm’s length review of one or more of the following recommendations to the Director of Waste Management:

values.label: Making a recommendation to a Director in support of an application for an Approval in Principle based on remediation to numerical standards or a screening level risk assessment where there is offsite migration at the site.

Making a recommendation to a Director in support of an application for an Approval in Principle based on a risk assessment (other than a screening level risk assessment) and remediation to risk-based standards.

Making a recommendation to a Director in support of an application for a Certificate of Compliance based on remediation to numerical standards or a screening level risk assessment where there is offsite migration at the site.

Making a recommendation to a Director in support of an application for a Certificate of Compliance based on a risk assessment (other than a screening level risk assessment) and remediation to risk-based standards.

Making a recommendation to a Director in support of any other application based on risk assessment or risk management (other than a screening level risk assessment) not otherwise described in any other row in this list, as required under a protocol signed by a Director.
Making a recommendation to a Director in support of an application for site risk classification/reclassification.

components.html: The Approved Professional(s) who carried out the arm’s length review to sign below.
components.label: Content

components.html: Part 8 - Statement of Site Owner / Agent / Lessee
components.label: Content
If it is known that one or more substances has migrated or is likely to have migrated to a neighbouring site and is or is likely causing contamination of the neighbouring site
Have owners of impacted offsite properties been formally notified?
Has the ministry been formally notified?

components.title: 8.2 Confirmations by Owner/Agent/Lessee Regarding Approved Professional
components.label: Panel
This is to acknowledge that as:

values.label: The Agent on behalf of the owner
The agent on behalf of the responsible party

components.html: as the Approved Professional(s) to review site investigation, risk assessment and remediation reports and to make submission and application with recommendations, if applicable, for the certification(s) as indicated in this Summary of Site Condition.
components.label: Content

components.html: If signing as the agent of the owner or lessee, written consent from the owner or lessee authorizing signature of this Summary of Site Condition must be attached
components.label: Content
I agree to comply with any requirements on the site regarding monitoring and maintenance of works as documented in schedule B of the draft certification document
I accept that if a risk assessment has been applied at the site, that the risk assessment is only valid as long as conditions at the site do not change.

I have undertaken reasonable inquiry into the previous ownership and uses of the property and to the best of my knowledge I have provided to the Approved Professional, information relevant to the investigation and remediation of the environmental condition of the site, in the preparation of this document.

I acknowledge that this Summary of Site Condition becomes a public document after it has been received and acknowledged by the Director of Waste Management. Any party intending to purchase, lease, take a security interest in, or occupy the site may review this Summary of Site Condition and any supporting documents to satisfy themselves with respect to the environmental condition of the site, and the extent of responsibility and liability that may arise from taking ownership, taking a security interest, or occupying the site.
I have made no modifications to this Summary of Site Condition except as allowed by the form

components.label: Submit
